N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 442.2 - Accounting entity

State Regulations
[ 1110 ]
A fundamental reporting concept
is that of the accounting entity or unit. For reporting purposes, the hospital
is presumed to be an entity capable of buying, selling and taking other
economic actions which are to be accounted for separately from the personal
affairs of those responsible for the hospital's administration. The hospital
itself is the primary unit for which the accounting records are maintained. However, most departments of the hospital usually assume sufficient importance
to require separate treatment as subordinate entities or units of
accountability for planning and control purposes. Notes
